I bow my head to the good and wise advisor, who can make one guard the fundamental mind, just like the power of a jewel suddenly clarifies the turbid water. Therefore, I am ordered to compile this record, to clarify the transmission of this Dharma. I vow to exhaust the future, widely opening the Buddha's insight.
The preface says:
My true Dharma body is attained by the Dharma Buddha.
Apart from the spoken teachings of the transformation Buddhas and the transmission of written words,
This true suchness gate is then transmitted through the self-realization of the enlightened mind.
Therefore, the treatise says:
All dharmas, from the very beginning, are apart from the characteristics of speech,
apart from the characteristics of names and words,
apart from the characteristics of mental activity.
They are ultimately equal,
without any change,
incapable of being destroyed.
It is only the one mind, therefore called true suchness.
It also says:
The mind of realization and enlightenment,
from the stage of pure mind up to the ultimate,
realizes what realm?
That is to say, true suchness is said to be the object-field based on the evolving consciousnesses.
But for the one who realizes this, there is no object-field.
Only the wisdom of true suchness is called the Dharma-body.
